summary: The Pacific Ocean is the biggest and deepest ocean on Earth. It covers about 46% of the world's water surface and is larger than all the land on Earth combined. It stretches from the Arctic in the north to the Southern Ocean in the south, and is bordered by Asia, Australia, and the Americas. The Pacific Ocean is divided into the North and South Pacific, and can also be split into four areas by the International Date Line. It has an average depth of 4,000 meters, and the deepest point on Earth, the Challenger Deep, is found in the Mariana Trench.
title: Pacific Ocean
